archimate:Requirement.name: 4.52.5 Firewall basic configuration control
archimate:Requirement.documentation: Firewalls should be configured to: protect communication protocols that are prone to abuse (e.g. HTTPS, SSH, SMTP, DNS and UUCP) block network packets typically used to execute denial of service attacks (e.g. ICMP Echo, UDP and TCP Echo, Chargen and Discard) deny incoming traffic where the source address is known to have been spoofed (e.g. where the source ad-dress claims to be from the destina-tion network) deny outgoing traffic where the source address is known to have been spoofed (e.g. where the source ad-dress does not reflect the network from which it originates) limit the disclosure of information about networks at the network level by using IP masquerading (i.e. net-work address translation (NAT) or port address translation (PAT)).
